comment.body:
I used Gentoo for short time and it is surely a very good and flexible OS. But I changed to Arch Linux, which is also highly flexible and with binaries for installation. The source installation from Gentoo is really good, but I takes too much time to install.
Anyway, I wish you good luck with Gentoo.
comment.body_p: I used Gentoo for short time and it is surely a very good and flexible OS. But I changed to Arch Linux, which is also highly flexible and with binaries for installation. The source installation from Gentoo is really good, but I takes too much time to install. Anyway, I wish you good luck with Gentoo.

topic.title: Arch Linux - The Swiss Army Knife for every purpose
topic.body:
I use Linux for about 20 years now and since a few years I landed at Arch Linux. I use it for my Laptop, Desktop computer and on my Raspberry Pi.
On my Raspberry Pi I use it for server and other services in the 32 bit ArmV7 version.
On my Desktop machine (Manjaro) I sometimes play a little bit my games from Steam.
On my Laptop I use Arch Linux as my daily proofed working station with KDE Plasma Desktop. I use it for writing with LibreOffice, scanning letters with XSane and SimpleScan and editing my photos with Darktable and of course Gimp. And for all the other office stuff.

What is your purpose with using Arch Linux?
How long do you use Arch Linux?
What do you like most of Arch Linux?
